results.title: One good reason
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Roland Beckett and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: An examination of the reactions of a career army man who is considering resigning to take advantage of an attractive offer to join a commercial organisation. Stars Bill Hunter as Major Archer.

results.title: One giant step
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Film shows how new technology is being used in the rehabilitation of the physically disabled. The range of aids available, from environmental control systems to communications aids are examined

results.title: One giant leap
results.creator_credit: Educational Media, Special Films Group, Associated British-Pathe and Richard Dunn
results.brief_description: Excellent historical footage is used in this film to trace the development of the rocket up to the first landing of man on the moon. The programs of the United States and Russia are shown, and a relatively unbiased account of successes and failures from Sputnik to Apollo is given.

results.title: One giant leap
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the amazing story of the Apollo 11 mission that led, on July 21, 1969, to Neil Armstrong landing on the moon. The program covers the planning of the operation, construction, interviews with ground crew and astronauts, as well as placing the event within a wider historical and social context.

results.title: One from the heart
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios, Gray Frederickson, Fred Roos and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: On their anniversary of 5 years together, Frannie (Teri Garr) walks out on Hank (Frederic Forrest). They are portrayed as unhappy, uncommunicative and finding fault with one another. Thus begins 48 hours in the lives of a recently separated couple. Both seek solace and answers in best friends Maggie (Lainie Kazan) and Moe (Harry Dean Stanton) then swiftly begin fledgling relationships with other people. Frannie with pianist and singer Ray (Raul Julia) - Hank with circus performer Leila (Nastassja Kinski). Not known for dabbling in romance or musicals, Coppola has managed to fashion a film about relationships, their deterioration, and our inability to change others with pathos and plenty of colour, music, dance and spectacle provided by the Las Vegas inspired sound stage. Songs and music by Tom Waits.

results.title: One for the road
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dennis A. Hill
results.brief_description: A few hours in the life of Bill Smith show why you should not mix drinking with driving. The affect of alcohol is illustrated with a model brain: although not drunk Smith’s brain power was sufficiently impaired to cause a fatal accident.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dennis A. Hill

results.title: One film, three scripts
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Present day Puerto Rico is the subject of this film, but the film’s innovative format provides an unusual opportunity to study communication techniques. The same film footage is repeated three times accompanied by three distinct and doctrinaire texts. The viewer is thereby challenged to evaluate whose “faith is being propagated” and by what means.

results.title: One drink away
results.creator_credit: HSV7, Victoria. Ministry of Education, Geoff Owen-Taylor and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Looks closely at alcoholism within the community and the devastating effects it can have on the home and industry. The organizations set up to help alcoholics and their families are also discussed. Hosted by Dan Webb.
